wikipedia_page.main: William Copeland Wood Murdoch (3 October 1914, Old Kilpatrick - October 1987, Helensburgh) was a Scottish international rugby union player who played at full-back.

response: Along with W.C.W. Murdoch, he was one of only two Scottish players to be capped on either side of World War II, giving him one of the longest international careers on record.Jones, pp56,57 John "Jack" HeatonJack Heaton | Rugby Union | Players and Officials | ESPN Scrum and Thomas Arthur "Tommy" KempTommy Kemp | Rugby Union | Players and Officials | ESPN Scrum also achieved this feat for .
